ratings.comment: 450 Swaney is very different from other classes; he's vert helpful in guiding the projects during office hours and has a lot of knowledge to share. However, old habits prevail: unorganized class, consistently behind schedule, doesn't know when his own exams are, and project info is scattered throughout 5-6 different PDFs. Overall, not bad.
Lectures are useless, no regard for other people's time, never provides direct answers.
Professor Swaney can be very helpful. Study the homework and discussion problems for the exams.
No confidence that swaney can solve his own problems without the answerkey. Rambles on in lecture. Is not helpful in office hours. Homework's are inconsiderately long

Prof. Swaney is an example of an intelligent/experienced engineer failing to teach well. Lectures weren't organized, consistently showed up 5-10 minutes late, long-winded, and only covered homework-relevant content on the class period before it was due. However, generous curve. I recommend heavily utilizing the textbook and TA office hours.

Professor Swaney is clearly a very smart man. However, he's not a good teacher. Rather than teaching us problem solving strategies, he merely summarized topics in class, often leaving us more confused than before the start of lecture. I would not recommend this professor at all, but you'll more than likely have him at some point.
Favorite professor I had, really cares about his students

A tough course, but with practice it aint too bad. Pf. Swaney as a person was really nice. Problem was that he would consistently come to lecture late and let us out around 3 min late. He is also pretty slow paced so he wouldnt get through the contents in time and we would have to rely on TAs and the 3 textbook he assigned us to solve our homeworks

Does not give good lectures and expects students to read the textbook in order to learn material. Never learned enough in lectures to complete a homework assignment. There are no examples given other than for discussions. He also never started classes on time and always finished them at least 5 minutes late, sometimes more.

Professor Swaney is an extremely kind-hearted individual. He writes very well-thought out exams that are definitely tricky, but doable with practice. The homeworks are very challenging. He really enjoys teaching and has a strong passion for chemical engineering, and it's a good experience to take a class with him as the professor.

-very knowledgable and kind
-respectable 
-intimidating at first, but available outside of class for questions and willing to answer anything
-exams are sometimes graded too harshly (doing the correct process but getting the wrong answer results in a 0 on the entire question)
-very boring/unorganized lectures

Swaney is a decent lecturer. Everything on the exam is explained in lecture and his exams/hw are fair. However, he can be sometimes boring in lecture. If you dont understand a concept, just call him on his phone and he will help you out! TAs are pretty lost in this class. Exams are very easy (much easier than HWs). Probably an easy AB class.

The course is uninspired, not well thought out, and lectures tend to be completely unrelated to the course projects or tests. If I learned anything from this course, it was from my TA and my fellow classmates, as well as trial and error through Aspen.

Prof Swaney does a poor job teaching what needs to be taught throughout the class. He spends lots of time about what you'll actually see out in "industry" which wastes a good amount of instruction time. He gives out homework that is pretty difficult and he only teaches how to do the homework two days before the homework is due. Midterms  good luck

His lectures are cut to the point and charismatic. His exams are really easy. I took three shots before taking it and aced it with an A. If you go to his office hours he will give you his homemade cookies. Prof. Swaney is the best!

professor doesn't teach you whats on the hw until after its turned in. It was bad enough that I changed my major just so I didn't have to take this class. programming is not for me, I loved the math, physics, and chem behind chemical engineering.
Great professor.  Challenges you to think on your own - long-winded but very helpful if you ask questions.

Homework and Exams are heavily lecture based the book is mostly just a reference. Pay attention and you'll never be surprised by the exam. He focuses on practical engineering knowledge and pretty much tells you exactly what he thinks is important (and will be on the exam).

Actually a good class, lectures are boring, but Prof. Swaney isn't that bad. He's made out to be a lot worse than he actually is. I found him extremely helpful one-on-one, and while the homework is pretty bad, exams are directly based on it and very fair.

Not the most interesting lecturer, but very helpful one-on-one. The class is fair, homework is often hard to figure out without help, exams are based on it. Overall he is made out to be worse than he actually is, I found him to be helpful and fair

He's a typical mid-aged bold man, not interesting at all. For some reason he was the only one teaching the courses. Course material is neutral, but it might take a lot of time depending on your comprehensibility of Matlab.
It's harder to try to understand what he's teaching than to sleep in class

I agree with everyone else too.  The class was a computer science/matlab course and he never taught us how to apply the concepts taught in lecture to Matlab, which was the whole point of the class.  Even though we begged for help, he was rarely available and took forever to respond to emails.  If you can avoid him, do it.
Swaney is an enigma. The biggest beef with him is that he doesn't do examples. Ever. But he still manages to explain things fairly well. Usually. Sometimes.
Does a lot of theory and very little examples.  He is helpful if you seek him out and ask for help.

I think he just doesn't know how to teach. He is always rambling in class; not even the most fanatic of students can understand him. He is the most disorganized lecturer I've had, and comes up with stupid reasons for not posting practice exams. I wouldn't take any more classes with him.
I agree with everyone else...

This is one of those unforuate classes that everyone has to take.  It is difficult to get time with the professor even if you request it. He finally explains how to do something 1 week before it is due making the student get NO sleep that week.

This is one of those unforuate classes that everyone has to take.  It is difficult to get time with the professor even if you request it. He finally explains how to do something 1 week before it is due making the student get NO sleep that week.

If you want to experience the most pointless, frustrating, and time-consuming class ever, take 450 with Swaney.  Maybe if he tried to do any of the work he gives us he'd understand what was going on.  But then he'd have to DO something.

Terrible prof.  Did not want to help students at all.  Made TAs do all the work, which is funny since this guy has no grad students and does no research.  What, you might ask, does he do? Who knows.  And he is super anal retentive.  Its fun to mess ar

Absolutely useless.  Can't teach, won't help students, assigns projects that he has no idea how to do, making them difficult to complete.  Won't attempt to help students on them because he's too lazy.  I wish I could get a refund for the class
